page.title: 11THE OBSERVATORY
page.content: An observatory is a building from which you can observe objects in the sky with the aid of telescopes. The {observatory} at Cranfield was built by Prof. Loxham at his home in Aspley Heath in 1968. In 1980 it was moved to its present position in Mitchell Mitchell Rd. It has a concrete floor, white glass walls and is 12' diameter. A motor drives the whole thing, the roof revolves so that the gap can be moved into the right position to see through. The turntable of the tele- scope is set parallel to the equator, the telescope can be moved on the turntable and on the tilting spindle. An astronomical society exists which looks after the telescopes; a 16" Cassegrain, a 3" Refractor Prominence (sun telescope), an 8"Newtonium, and a 6" Refractor.
